1.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
1.description: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

2.name: A Star Is Born
2.description: A young woman comes to Hollywood with dreams of stardom, but achieves them only with the help of an alcoholic leading man whose best days are behind him.

3.name: Silver Blaze
3.description: Sherlock Holmes takes a vacation and visits his old friend Sir Henry Baskerville. His vacation ends when he suddenly finds himself in the middle of a double-murder mystery. Now he's got to ...                See full summary »

4.name: Captains Courageous
4.description: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep by joining the crew in their work.

5.name: Don't Tell the Wife
5.description: A seasoned con artist and his associates discover that their scheme to get rich by selling stock in a worthless gold mine is fraught with obstacles.

6.name: Way Out West
6.description: Stanley and Ollie are enlisted to deliver the deed to a goldmine in a small village, only for it to be stolen.

7.name: La Grande Illusion
7.description: During the First World War, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are sent to a seemingly impenetrable fortress which seems impossible to escape from.

8.name: Lost Horizon
8.description: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La - but is it the miraculous utopia it appears to be?

9.name: Sh! The Octopus
9.description: Comedy-mystery finds Detectives Kelly and Dempsey trapped in a deserted lighthouse with a group of strangers who are being terrorized by a killer octopus AND a mysterious crime figure named...                See full summary »

10.name: The Awful Truth
10.description: Unfounded suspicions lead a married couple to begin divorce proceedings, whereupon they start undermining each other's attempts to find new romance.

11.name: Make Way for Tomorrow
11.description: An elderly couple are forced to separate when they lose their house and none of their five children will take both parents in.

12.name: Topper
12.description: A fun-loving couple, finding that they died and are now ghosts, decide to shake up the stuffy lifestyle of a friend of theirs.

13.name: Stage Door
13.description: A chronicle of the ambitions, dreams, and disappointments of aspiring actresses who all live in the same boarding house.

14.name: Heidi
14.description: A plucky little orphan girl gets dumped abruptly into her gruff, hermit grandfather's care, then later gets retaken and delivered as a companion for an injured girl.

15.name: The Last Gangster
15.description: A gangster is jailed for ten years after his wife becomes pregnant. He becomes bitter when she divorces him and remarries.

16.name: Dead End
16.description: The lives of a young man and woman, an infamous gangster and a group of street kids converge one day in a volatile New York City slum.

17.name: A Day at the Races
17.description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse.

18.name: Good Morning, Boys
18.description: A schoolteacher and his pupils visit Paris where they outwit a gang of crooks.

19.name: Shall We Dance
19.description: A budding romance between a ballet master and a tap dancer becomes complicated when rumors surface that they're already married.

20.name: Young and Innocent
20.description: A man on the run from a murder charge enlists a beautiful stranger who must put herself at risk for his cause.

21.name: You Only Live Once
21.description: The public defender's secretary and an ex-convict get married and try to make a life together, but a series of disasters sends their lives spiraling out of control.

22.name: Stella Dallas
22.description: A working-class woman is willing to do whatever it takes to give her daughter a socially promising future.

23.name: Fire Over England
23.description: Queen Elizabeth is running this show. The men in her court should be thinking about how to add to the glory of the Elizabethan Age and how to foil those pesky Spanish who got far too much ...                See full summary »

24.name: Pépé le Moko
24.description: A wanted gangster is both king and prisoner of the Casbah. He is protected from arrest by his friends, but is torn by his desire for freedom outside. A visiting Parisian beauty may just tempt his fate.

25.name: Thunder in the City
25.description: A visiting American engages in a bold business promotion, the likes of which the British have not seen.

26.name: Black Legion
26.description: When a hard-working machinist loses a promotion to a Polish-born worker, he is seduced into joining the secretive Black Legion, which intimidates foreigners through violence.

27.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
27.description: An Englishman on a Ruritarian holiday must impersonate the king when the rightful monarch, a distant cousin, is drugged and kidnapped.

28.name: Nothing Sacred
28.description: An eccentric woman learns she is not dying of radium poisoning as earlier assumed, but when she meets a reporter looking for a story, she feigns sickness again for her own profit.

29.name: The Good Earth
29.description: Although married Chinese farmers Wang and O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times, as well as the arrival of the beautiful young Lotus.

30.name: Storm in a Teacup
30.description: A local politician in Scotland tries to break the reporter who wrote a negative story about him, and who is also in love with his daughter.

31.name: The Life of Emile Zola
31.description: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfuss Affair.

32.name: The Man Who Found Himself
32.description: A "high flying" surgeon learns a few valuable life lessons at the hands of a beautiful nurse.

33.name: Saratoga
33.description: After winning a stud farm in lieu of gambling debts, bookie Duke Bradley turns an eye to the daughter of the now deceased gambler and her millionaire fiancée.

34.name: The Prince and the Pauper
34.description: A poor boy named Tom Canty and the Prince of Wales exchange identities but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.

35.name: Marked Woman
35.description: A crusading DA persuades a clip joint "party girl" to testify against her mobster boss after her innocent sister is accidentally murdered during one of his unsavory "parties".

36.name: Wee Willie Winkie
36.description: Priscilla Williams, a young girl living with her widowed mother and paternal grandfather at the post he commands in northern India, becomes enamored of military life and embroiled in brewing rebellion against the crown in the early 1900's.

37.name: A Damsel in Distress
37.description: Lady Alyce Marshmorton must marry soon, and the staff of Tottney Castle have laid bets on who she'll choose, with young Albert wagering on "Mr. X". After Alyce goes to London to meet a beau...                See full summary »

38.name: They Won't Forget
38.description: A politically ambitious district attorney, unscrupulous tabloid journalists, and regional prejudice combine to charge a teacher with the murder of his student.

39.name: It's Love I'm After
39.description: An actor of the stage finds himself pursued by a lovestruck fan while trying to patch up a tempestuous relationship with his actress lover.

40.name: Dick Tracy
40.description: A master criminal called The Spider puts the famous detective's brother under a hypnotic spell and turns him against Dick.

41.name: The Hurricane
41.description: A Polynesian sailor -- unjustly imprisoned after defending himself against a colonial bully -- is relentlessly persecuted by his island's martinet French governor.

42.name: Dark Journey
42.description: During World War I, a German spy and a French spy meet and fall in love.

43.name: Something to Sing About
43.description: A New York bandleader journeys to Hollywood when he is offered a contract with a studio, but he is determined to do things his way and not theirs.

44.name: Angel
44.description: A woman and her husband take separate vacations, and she falls in love with another man.

45.name: Elephant Boy
45.description: This black and white movie is based on Rudyard Kipling's "Toomai, of the Elephants", in which a small native lad claims he knows the congregating place of the elephant hordes.

46.name: King Solomon's Mines
46.description: White hunter Allan Quartermain and his enigmatic guide help a young Irish woman locate her missing father in unexplored Darkest Africa.

47.name: Easy Living
47.description: During the Great Depression, a wealthy banker throws away his wife's expensive fur coat; it lands on the head of a stenographer, leading to everyone assuming she is his mistress and has access to his millions.

48.name: Charlie Chan at the Olympics
48.description: When a strategically important new aerial guidance system is stolen, Charlie traces it to the Berlin Olympics, where he has to battle spies and enemy agents to retrieve it.

49.name: Hollywood Hotel
49.description: Ronny Bowers, a saxophonist in Benny Goodman's band has won a talent contest an got a ten week contract with a film studio. On his first evening he is supposed to go with the studio's star ...                See full summary »

50.name: Broadway Melody of 1938
50.description: Steve Raleight wants to produce a show on Broadway. He finds a backer, Herman Whipple and a leading lady, Sally Lee. But Caroline Whipple forces Steve to use a known star, not a newcomer. ...                See full summary »
